physical_appearance:This is a fifty cent Japanese government currency. The note is printed in reddish-brown ink. The number \u002750\u0027 is printed on the four corners of the note. The words in the center are in capitals. The currency features a large banana tree on the right side. There are some kanji inscriptions along the bottom of the note. The note is quite worn out
 with some tears and folds around the edges.

sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Fifty cents Japanese banana money
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a fifty cent Japanese government currency. The note is printed in reddish-brown ink. The number '50' is printed on the four corners of the note. The words in the center are in capitals. The currency features a large banana tree on the right side. There are some kanji inscriptions along the bottom of the note. The note is quite worn out, with some tears and folds around the edges.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war occupation currency Kanji (writing system)
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Money Occupation currency, Japanese Kanji
metadata.context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
